subject: Re: [junit] Displaying the Method Being Executed in JUnit
msgSnippet: James, Thanks, The config WAS set to WARN I am getting the log messages now. -Kamal. ... From: James Abley  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
James,

Thanks,
The config WAS set to WARN
I am getting the log messages now.
-Kamal.

----- Original Message ----
From: James Abley <james.abley@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, March 20, 2008 6:28:43 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] Displaying the Method Being Executed in JUnit

On 14/03/2008, Kamal <kamal2222ahmed@ yahoo.com> wrote:
>
> Re: [junit] test for super()
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Kamal
> To: junit@yahoogroups. com
> Sent: Friday, March 14, 2008 2:06 PM
> Subject: Displaying the Method Being Executed in JUnit
>
> Hi,
>
> I have a BaseTest Class with the log4j logger as:
>
> protected void setUp() {
>
> sLog.info("Now Running the testcase : " + this.getClass( ).getSimpleName( ) + "." + this.getName( ));
>
>
> Now, in the test class, i call :
>
> public void setUp() {
> super.setUp( );
>
> Now, when i run the testMethod() i SHOULD get a Log4J Logging statement on stdout
>
> but, i am not getting Anything, Any ideas?
>
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
>

Use a debugger?

Change to use System.out (might be the logging config is set to WARN,
for example).

Cheers,

James
